data.title: Nancy Gibbs
data.meta_description: Read the latest stories by Nancy Gibbs on Time
data.text:
How America Can Still Come Together

Former TIME editor-in-chief Nancy Gibbs writes that Americans are largely in agreement on key issues and need unity in the face of violence.

The Debate Was a Mess. Where We Go From Here

Debates are a test of candidates; post debates are a test of everyone else.

How the Press Can Rebuild Trust This Election

In an unprecedented year, the core of journalism remains the same

Humans still need to oversee the internet

Former TIME Editor-in-Chief Nancy Gibbs makes the case for humans in the age of AI.

Gibbs: A Historic—and Entirely Predictable—Indictment

'The scandal of Donald Trump’s passage through public life rests both in what he has done and what he has left undone'

The Impact of TIME’s First Cover

Nancy Gibbs, the first woman to be editor-in-chief of TIME, on the lasting influence of the magazine's 1923 debut.

Bob Dole, Senate Legend Who Championed Compromise, Dies

Nothing in Dole’s life was easy, and that’s the way he wanted it

What There Was To Be Grateful For in 2018

A Revolutionary Suggestion for Word of the Year: Listen

An act of courage, in a year of shouting and division
